programme.desc: The veteran naturalist investigates two shells that have proved to be winners in evolution - the bird's egg shell and the hard shell of the tortoise. The ostrich egg is so strong it is possible for it to take a person's weight without breaking - so how does a chick manage break out of such a fortress? The evolution of the tortoise shell was for a long time a mystery, and this bony box offers a lot more than just protection.

programme.desc: Sicknote spends his first night at the protest camp. Meanwhile, a shocking discovery at a hoax call leads Billy to make a big decision.

programme.desc: Beth and Jack are excited about their wedding day, but their friends' idyllic marriage reveals deeper feelings which bring them down to earth. Starring Amanda Burton and Kevin Whately.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Samantha Janus guest stars as the wife of a man with a muscle-wasting disease, who arouses Kim's suspicions when she comes into the hospital sporting bruises. Danny struggles to cope with Cady, while Harding and David are unsure what to tell Anna about the factory's problems. Nathan worries about Billy's parenting skills, and Zoe gets more than she bargained for after organising a pub quiz team.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: Sharon seems to be losing Chris and, more importantly, the ownership of the cafe. Meanwhile, Dorien has to choose between love and luxury. Comedy, starring Pauline Quirke and Linda Robson.

programme.title: To the Manor Born
programme.desc: Audrey, Marjory and their Nature Conservancy friends try to foil DeVere's plans to change the countryside - but Mrs fforbes-Hamilton quickly changes allegiance when their plot is unsuccessful. Comedy, starring Penelope Keith and Peter Bowles.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Foggy plans to convert an old boat into a water taxi, but when work is finally completed Compo becomes obsessed with getting Nora Batty on board.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: The Empire That Foggy Nearly Built
programme.desc: After witnessing an argument between two motorists over an available space, Foggy hits on another get-rich-quick scheme - this time in the form of a car-parking scheme. Rural comedy, starring Brian Wilde, Peter Sallis and Bill Owen.

programme.title: Shakespeare & Hathaway - Private Investigators
programme.desc: Frank and Lu investigate after an ex-soap star receives death threats after rewriting Romeo and Juliet as a feminist tract. After the self-centred actress is poisoned on stage, suspects include the director who worked with her in a soap with a similar poison plot-line and his lover, an understudy to the production. Guest starring Morgana Robinson and Ramon Tikaram.

programme.title: The Coroner
programme.desc: A death in custody brings Jane into contact with child killer Sidney Sutton and she hopes the case may help her to find the final resting place of his teenage victim.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: While Sasha is occupied with a training course, the boys' investigations take them to a lookalike agency, where their top two acts were found dead in an apparent double suicide 13 years ago. In an industry reliant on the art of the illusion and their suspects intent on giving them the run around, Ted, Steve and Danny are convinced there's more to this case than first meets the eye. Steve is thrilled when their enquiries take them to the door of one of his football heroes, but his glee is short-lived. Detective drama, starring Denis Lawson.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Four bodies are found in the Thames after a boat full of illegal immigrants founders. Realising they are dealing with a people-trafficking operation gone disastrously wrong, Leo, Harry and Nikki set out to discover whether there are any survivors, while delving into the victims' pasts. Feature-length episode, guest starring Burt Kwouk.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.sub-title: When Justice Isn't Enough - Part Three
programme.desc: Part three of three. Suspected gay serial killers John Lord and Michael Keenan are brought in for questioning. In spite of the stack of circumstantial evidence against them, a confession looks a long way off as the detectives get deeply embroiled in a battle of wits. Phil Hunter is stunned when wife Cindy breaks down in his arms with news about her IVF treatment.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Sicknote spends his first night at the protest camp. Meanwhile, a shocking discovery at a hoax call leads Billy to make a big decision.

programme.title: Teleshopping

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: The emotional experience of delivering a baby together helps to reconcile Peggy and Ruth, while Vic learns the reason behind Stephen leaving university. Elsewhere, Mary Cooper causes chaos when she gets behind the wheel of a car. Sarah Lancashire, Pam Ferris, Tony Haygarth and Thomas Craig star.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: A nurse with her head full of new ideas joins the ranks, ruffling Peggy and Ruth's feathers, while Stephen's barely got his feet back under his mum's table before he's drawn into a steamy love triangle.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The roguish antiques dealer whisks Charlotte away for a weekend in Wales, but before long they find themselves hunting for a murderer and a rare Celtic cross. Drama, starring Ian McShane and Caroline Langrishe.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The dodgy dealer agrees to help Charlotte's friend Mary Gladden save a nursing home by valuing and selling its antiques - only to find himself in the line of fire as someone makes an attempt on his life. Drama, starring Ian McShane, Dudley Sutton, Caroline Langrishe and Susan Fleetwood.

programme.title: Sharpe
programme.desc: Framed by long-time enemy Ducos for stealing Napoleon's treasures, Sharpe is abandoned by his wife Jane, and goes on the run from both the English and the French until he can prove his innocence. Period adventure, starring Sean Bean, Daragh O'Malley, Abigail Cruttenden and Cecile Paoli.

programme.title: Shakespeare & Hathaway - Private Investigators
programme.desc: Frank and Lu investigate after an ex-soap star receives death threats after rewriting Romeo and Juliet as a feminist tract. After the self-centred actress is poisoned on stage, suspects include the director who worked with her in a soap with a similar poison plot-line and his lover, an understudy to the production. Guest starring Morgana Robinson and Ramon Tikaram.

programme.title: Dalziel & Pascoe
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Dalziel hunts a killer with a taste for antique porcelain, while Pascoe puts his promotion celebrations on hold to investigate the shooting of three old friends and uncovers a Scottish oil fraud. Warren Clarke and Colin Buchanan star, with Michael Pennington and Patrick Ryecart.

programme.title: Dalziel & Pascoe
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The mismatched detectives go on the trail of the Wetherton Choker, a killer who calls the local paper with a quotation from Hamlet each time he claims a victim. After the services of a fortune-teller are enlisted, suspicion falls on a nearby gypsy camp. Drama, starring Warren Clarke and Colin Buchanan.

programme.title: The Brokenwood Mysteries
programme.desc: Crime author Jack Rudd visits Brokenwood to give a reading at the local book club - but he never leaves, falling victim to a method of murder portrayed in his own book.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: Flambeau enlists Fr Brown's help to steal the Queen's coronation gift from the Pope. Fifties-set crime drama based on the stories by GK Chesterton, starring Mark Williams.

programme.title: Ashes to Ashes
programme.desc: A body is found in an ANC drinking den and Gene quickly decides a girl is guilty of the murder. However, the group's leader complicates matters by confessing to the crime to stop the suspect being deported, pitching the team into a world of illegal immigration and terrorism. Jim's report is nearly finished, but he continues to push Alex to find out what really happened to Sam Tyler.

programme.title: Ashes to Ashes
programme.desc: With the team's attention focused on investigating a diamond robbery and the murder of three gang members, Alex slips away, vowing to learn the truth about Gene Hunt. When the DCI realises what she is up to, he sets off in pursuit, knowing her discoveries will destroy his world. Final episode of the fantasy crime drama, starring Philip Glenister, Keeley Hawes, Dean Andrews and Marshall Lancaster.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Gerry is forced to confront his past when the team reinvestigates the 33-year-old murder of a doctor whose body was found hanging from a meat hook on a butcher's stall at Smithfield Market. The butcher had gone missing on the same day, and since then the community has rallied to help his widow keep the business afloat. However, his recently discovered remains reveal a match to an unidentified person and lead to a shocking revelation for Sandra. Guest starring Ken Farrington, David Calder and Diana Quick, with Amanda Redman and Alun Armstrong.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Sandy's policeman boyfriend calls at the house with important news and Alistair suddenly realises he wants to settle down, but he can't decide what should come first - work or romance. Starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The roguish antiques dealer whisks Charlotte away for a weekend in Wales, but before long they find themselves hunting for a murderer and a rare Celtic cross. Drama, starring Ian McShane and Caroline Langrishe.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The dodgy dealer agrees to help Charlotte's friend Mary Gladden save a nursing home by valuing and selling its antiques - only to find himself in the line of fire as someone makes an attempt on his life. Drama, starring Ian McShane, Dudley Sutton, Caroline Langrishe and Susan Fleetwood.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Lance Powell goes undercover in a gay bar in a successful operation to catch a dealer selling lethal crystal meth, but his personal life takes a knock when partner Mark announces he's leaving the Met. Difficult decisions have to be made about a young tearaway when he's accused of mugging an old man, and a remorseful Terry reconsiders his relationship with Lucy after letting Bradley down yet again.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.sub-title: A Small Piece of the Pie
programme.desc: Neil Manson returns to Sun Hill to work on the murder of a gay man and Phil Hunter spots a pattern in similar recent crimes. Lance Powell teams up with Laura Bryant to investigate a spate of robberies for which the local vicar turns out to be the chief suspect. Mark leaves his partner distraught when he moves out to find some space, and Cindy urges her reluctant husband to open the results of the paternity test.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.sub-title: When Justice Isn't Enough - Part One
programme.desc: Part one of three. An anonymous caller alerts Phil Hunter to common threads in recent murders, and the team starts looking for a serial killer on the Sun Hill gay scene. Lance Powell struggles to come to terms with Mark's decision to take time out from their relationship and decides to drown his sorrows, but a visit to the gay bar he recently investigated puts him in grave danger.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.sub-title: When Justice Isn't Enough - Part Two
programme.desc: Part two of three. The shocked Sun Hill relief pull out all the stops to find the killer of popular colleague Lance Powell. As a tearful Laura Bryant is sent home on compassionate leave, a witness provides a breakthrough, and the trail of evidence leads back to Michael Keenan, the barman at gay club Radar. Amid the emotional turmoil, Phil Hunter accompanies Kate as she registers the birth of their son, and is devastated to learn she's leaving to live with her mother in Cardiff.

programme.title: Bramwell
programme.desc: Period medical drama chronicling the personal and professional consequences of Eleanor Bramwell's determined quest to become the first female surgeon at the East London Hospital. Jemma Redgrave stars.

programme.title: Bramwell
programme.desc: Period medical drama chronicling the personal and professional consequences of Eleanor Bramwell's determined quest to become the first female surgeon at the East London Hospital. Jemma Redgrave stars.

programme.title: Catherine Cookson's The Cinder Path
programme.desc: Drama about one man's journey through love and war in the early part of the century. Charlie MacFell returns from university to the family farm, where his strict father still rules with an iron fist _ a situation that soon changes thanks to a misunderstanding with a foolish farmhand. Lloyd Owen stars, with Catherine Zeta Jones, Tom Bell and Maria Mile.

programme.title: A Place to Call Home
programme.desc: Ash Park prepares for a visit from the Prime Minister and his wife in support of George's election campaign, and James begins to learn how to relax in public with Harry.

programme.title: A Place to Call Home
programme.desc: On the day of the Prime Minister's visit to Ash Park, Regina is in her element making preparations and George is happy to make a speech to his supporters gathered at the gates. Sarah, knowing that she would not be welcome, awaits Harry at Inverness hospital from his transfer from Sydney. Elizabeth, meanwhile, has to time her return home with military precision.

programme.title: Keeping Up Appearances
programme.desc: Hyacinth is waiting for a new three-piece suite to be delivered and goes to extraordinary lengths to ensure her neighbours see the royal warrant on the delivery van. But, as ever, her family contrives to take the gloss off her moment of glory. Comedy, starring Patricia Routledge.

programme.title: Keeping Up Appearances
programme.desc: Hyacinth decides to take Daddy out for a picnic, but her plans soon backfire. Suburban comedy, starring Patricia Routledge, Clive Swift and Geoffrey Hughes.

programme.title: Keeping Up Appearances
programme.desc: While Richard contends with the idea of taking early retirement, Hyacinth telephones the prime minister asking if there is anything on the honours list for him. The hen-pecked husband's reservations about the future intensify when he discovers all the plans his spouse has in store for him. Comedy, starring Clive Swift and Patricia Routledge.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: Kris Marshall is back as the British detective working on the Caribbean island of Saint Marie, where the sun shines all day and it seems half the residents are killers-in-waiting. And so it appears with the first case when a plantation owner ends up dead during a seance - although with the door firmly closed at the time and all the participants holding hands round the table, who did the deed? The victim's family are convinced it was the work of a ghost said to haunt the plantation, but Humphrey is determined to find a more rational explanation. Meanwhile, Fidel has moved on, leaving Officer Dwayne Myers holding the fort - and while he is struggling to cope, the last thing he needs is the Commissioner stepping in to help. Crime drama, with guest appearances from Holby City's Don Gilet and former Corrie bad girl Natalie Gumede.

programme.title: Harrow
programme.desc: While Grace autopsies the body of an elderly man discovered in an Egyptian sarcophagus, Harrow finds himself trapped in a battle for his own life at the hands of Chester. Australian drama, starring Ioan Gruffudd and Jolene Anderson.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: The leader of a ship workers' union is shot dead in the middle of a labour dispute and his boss sustains gunshot wounds. Burke and Reid initially believe they may have a corporate killing on their hands, but the case remains far from clear until alarming evidence is uncovered that brings everything into sharp focus. Detective drama, guest starring Gordon Kennedy and Joanna Roth.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The squad reopens the investigation into an actress's disappearance when clips of her being assaulted in a 1990 movie are posted on the internet. Director Don Maddox features in the footage, but when questioned, he appears to have problems distinguishing fact from fiction. A potential witness is then found dead, and Brian and Jack are seconded to the unit handling the case, only to find Emily Driscoll (Dennis Waterman's daughter Hannah) is heading the operation. Imogen Stubbs and Sandra Dickinson also guest star.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The squad reinvestigates the death of a timeshare magnate, previously thought to have committed suicide, when a reformed call girl claims she was with him the night he died and saw someone force their way into his house as she left. It then emerges the deceased's widow has since fallen on hard times after being swindled by her late husband's business partner - who is connected to a notorious criminal. Guest starring Shane Richie, Naomi Bentley and Claire Rushbrook.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Don't Ask Me Ask Britain
programme.desc: Live interactive comedy game show hosted by Alexander Armstrong, which uses an app to poll the viewing public on moral dilemmas big and small. Celebrity teams, led by Frank Skinner and Jonathan Ross, go head to head to second guess the views of the nation.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Entertainment, current affairs and fashion news, as well as showbiz stories and celebrity gossip. Presented by Lorraine Kelly.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: A mix of celebrity chat, lifestyle features, advice and competitions.

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: Celebrity interviews and studio discussion from a female perspective.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Warwick Davis hosts the quiz, which sees a team of charity volunteers from Cambridgeshire competing to answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of popular culture and general knowledge. They then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Carole, Helena, Ben and Wes pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: With Mandy and Vinny holed up in the salon for lockdown, things are a little less conventional. They have an endless supply of beauty products, some beers, a microwave and a karaoke machine. With Paul the main topic of conversation, Mandy and Vinny navigate through their past and soon Mandy discloses a long-held secret that has affected her whole life. Vinny at last understands her resentments and fears.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Carla insists that she has no idea who Chelsey is, but is shocked when she reminds Ms Connor that she stayed in her squat when she was sleeping rough last year. Sally refuses to sit with Tim and Geoff in the pub, and Daniel is thrilled when Adam offers to spend his birthday with him and Bertie.

programme.title: Coronavirus: Q&A
programme.desc: Nina Hossain puts viewers' questions on a range of subjects relating to the Covid-19 outbreak to a panel of expert guests.

programme.title: Grow Your Own at Home with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Alan harvests the first of the radishes he planted as seeds in the first edition of the programme and steps inside his greenhouse to grow an exotic treat or two. Frances Tophill gives a seed-to- plate guide to growing chillies, David Domoney grows barbecue favourites and Katie Rushworth gets healthy with her pick of the best super-foods to grow in even the tiniest of spaces.

programme.title: Broadchurch
programme.desc: The detectives have their work cut out identifying key suspects, especially as the location of Danny's murder is still a mystery, but Miller discovers some suspicious items taped under the victim's bed and in his sister Chloe's room, which could help them get closer to the truth. Meanwhile, Hardy finds an isolated clifftop hut that arouses his curiosity, the Latimers struggle to cope with their grief and the Rev Paul Coates decides to address the local media. Crime drama, starring David Tennant, Olivia Colman, Arthur Darvill, Andrew Buchan and Jodie Whittaker.

Delving into the victim's story, she unearths a sad childhood in the country and a troubled life in the city, scraping by as a novelist. Following the recent death of his grandfather, he returned to Northumberland after a 15-year absence to sell his inheritance to a wealthy couple - but pulled out of the deal at the last minute. Three pairs of players will be choosing the top, middle or bottom as they navigate their way across a sea of screens, trying not to let their greed stop them banking too many prizes, and avoiding the infamous hotspots. One lucky pair will reach the endgame, where they stand to win a mountain of prizes and a luxury holiday to Las Vegas.

programme.title: Tipping Point: Lucky Stars
programme.desc: Coronation Street's Jack P Shepherd (David Platt), Strictly Come Dancing judge Len Goodman, and actress and presenter Liza Tarbuck join Ben Shephard to take part in a special edition of the quiz show. All three contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine, into which they drop tokens in the hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf. The more tokens they manage to collect, the better their chances of collecting the £20,000 prize for their selected charity.

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Good Morning Britain's Ranvir Singh, journalist John Sergeant, ex-rugby international Ugo Monye and TV presenter Mariella Frostrup pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: Tomb Raider (2018)
programme.desc: A kickboxing heiress risks her life to save her missing father when she discovers a clue to his location. However, she also crosses paths with a small army of mercenaries determined to break into a supposedly haunted tomb. Action adventure based on the video game, starring Alicia Vikander, Dominic West, Walton Goggins and Kristin Scott Thomas.

programme.title: Cilla: The Lost Tapes
programme.desc: Following her death, Cilla Black's family found a stash of films and behind-the-scenes footage from her personal video collection, along with hours of audio recording of Cilla telling her life story. Narrated by Sheridan Smith, this documentary includes interviews with the family and friends who knew Cilla best, as they watch the lost footage for the first time and recall their memories of a TV icon.

programme.title: Last Laugh in Vegas
programme.desc: Comedians Cannon and Ball, Bernie Clifton, Kenny Lynch and Mick Miller, join forces with musicians Bobby Crush, Jess Conrad, Anita Harris and actress Su Pollard to stage their dream gig in Nevada. For two weeks they'll live together, explore the city and rehearse with Las Vegas producer Frank Marino, preparing for the biggest performance of their lives in one of the area's most iconic theatres.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Don't Ask Me Ask Britain
programme.desc: Interactive comedy game show hosted by Alexander Armstrong, which uses an app to poll the viewing public on moral dilemmas big and small. Celebrity teams, led by Frank Skinner and Jonathan Ross, go head to head to try and second guess the views of the nation.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: How It's Made

programme.title: How Do They Do It?

programme.title: Shed and Buried
programme.desc: Henry and Sam are in East Anglia with Nick, who's mad about Morris Minors. However, he also loves motorbikes, both British and Japanese, as well as vintage bicycles. Henry and Sam spot a few bikes they like, one in particular may need some serious restoration.

programme.title: Shed and Buried
programme.desc: Henry and Sam are in Henry's home county of Oxfordshire in search of new bargains. They meet three brothers with containers full of bikes, plus many tractors, trucks and other trinkets. Sam is keen on getting a motorbike and Henry agrees, but Henry also has his eye on something else….

programme.title: Scrap Kings
programme.desc: In Cheshire, a well-known hotel is pulled to the ground. Meanwhile, in Devon a father and son demolish a caravan and in Liverpool an iconic landmark is made from scrap.

programme.title: The Repair Shop

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Car restorer Wayne Carini attends an annual car collectors' pig roast in a Porsche racing car.
